Recall: expected values are integrals, and vice versa.

Recall: central limit theorem (CLT) states that if $\theta_i |\vec{y}$ iid with mean $\mu$ and finite variance $\sigma^2$, for $i \in \{1, \ldots, N\}$,

$$
\bar{\theta} \sim N(E~\theta|\vec{y}, \frac{\sigma^2}{N} )
$$
